verses.kjv: Moreover Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Let me now choose out twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David this night:
verses.ct: Ahithophel said to Absalom, "Let me select 12,000 men, and I'll go after David tonight.

verses.kjv: And I will come upon him while he is weary and weak handed, and will make him afraid: and all the people that are with him shall flee; and I will smite the king only:
verses.ct: I'll attack him while he's exhausted and vulnerable, and throw him into a panic. Everyone with him will scatter, and I'll kill only the king.

verses.kjv: And I will bring back all the people unto thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all returned: so all the people shall be in peace.
verses.ct: Then I'll bring all the people back to you. Once the man you're after is dead, everyone else will return peacefully. The whole nation will be at peace."

verses.kjv: And the saying pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel.
verses.ct: This plan sounded good to Absalom and to all the elders of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then said Absalom, Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what he saith.
verses.ct: But Absalom said, "Bring in Hushai the Archite too. Let's hear what he has to say."

verses.kjv: And when Hushai was come to Absalom, Absalom spake unto him, saying, Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner: shall we do after his saying? if not; speak thou.
verses.ct: When Hushai arrived, Absalom told him, "Ahithophel has proposed this plan. Should we follow his advice? If not, give us your recommendation."

verses.kjv: And Hushai said unto Absalom, The counsel that Ahithophel hath given is not good at this time.
verses.ct: Hushai replied to Absalom, "The advice Ahithophel has given is not sound this time."

verses.kjv: For, said Hushai, thou knowest thy father and his men, that they be mighty men, and they be chafed in their minds, as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field: and thy father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.
verses.ct: Hushai continued, "You know your father and his men — they are fierce warriors, and right now they're as furious as a bear whose cubs have been stolen. Your father is an experienced soldier. He won't be sleeping among the troops.

verses.kjv: Behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some other place: and it will come to pass, when some of them be overthrown at the first, that whosoever heareth it will say, There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom.
verses.ct: Right now he's probably hiding in a cave or some other concealed spot. If some of your men fall in the first attack, whoever hears about it will say, 'Absalom's forces have been massacred!'

verses.kjv: And he also that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, shall utterly melt: for all Israel knoweth that thy father is a mighty man, and they which be with him are valiant men.
verses.ct: Then even the bravest soldier, one with the courage of a lion, will lose all nerve — because everyone in Israel knows your father is a powerful warrior, and the men with him are fearless.

verses.kjv: Therefore I counsel that all Israel be generally gathered unto thee, from Dan even to Beersheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that thou go to battle in thine own person.
verses.ct: So here's my advice: gather all of Israel to yourself, from Dan all the way to Beersheba — an army as countless as sand on the seashore — and lead them into battle personally.

verses.kjv: So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found, and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground: and of him and of all the men that are with him there shall not be left so much as one.
verses.ct: Then we'll find him wherever he's hiding and overwhelm him the way dew settles on the ground. Not one of his men will survive — not even him.

verses.kjv: Moreover, if he be gotten into a city, then shall all Israel bring ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until there be not one small stone found there.
verses.ct: And if he retreats into a city, then all of Israel will bring ropes to that city, and we'll drag it down into the valley until not even a pebble remains."

verses.kjv: And Absalom and all the men of Israel said, The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel. For the LORD had appointed to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that the LORD might bring evil upon Absalom.
verses.ct: Absalom and all the men of Israel said, "Hushai the Archite's advice is better than Ahithophel's." This was because the LORD had determined to undermine Ahithophel's good counsel so that the LORD would bring disaster on Absalom.

verses.kjv: Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel; and thus and thus have I counselled.
verses.ct: Then Hushai told the priests Zadok and Abiathar, "Here's what Ahithophel advised Absalom and the elders of Israel, and here's what I advised instead.

verses.kjv: Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying, Lodge not this night in the plains of the wilderness, but speedily pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people that are with him.
verses.ct: Now send a message to David immediately. Tell him, 'Don't spend tonight at the river crossings in the wilderness. Cross over right away, or the king and everyone with him will be destroyed.'"

verses.kjv: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by Enrogel; for they might not be seen to come into the city: and a wench went and told them; and they went and told king David.
verses.ct: Jonathan and Ahimaaz were waiting at En-rogel, since they couldn't risk being seen entering the city. A servant girl would go out and relay messages to them, and they would carry the information to King David.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless a lad saw them, and told Absalom: but they went both of them away quickly, and came to a man’s house in Bahurim, which had a well in his court; whither they went down.
verses.ct: But a young man spotted them and reported it to Absalom. So the two of them hurried away and reached the house of a man in Bahurim who had a well in his courtyard. They climbed down into it.

verses.kjv: And the woman took and spread a covering over the well’s mouth, and spread ground corn thereon; and the thing was not known.
verses.ct: The man's wife took a covering and spread it over the opening of the well, then scattered grain on top of it. No one could tell anything was there.

verses.kjv: And when Absalom’s servants came to the woman to the house, they said, Where is Ahimaaz and Jonathan? And the woman said unto them, They be gone over the brook of water. And when they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: When Absalom's servants arrived at the house, they asked the woman, "Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?" She told them, "They crossed over the stream." The men searched but couldn't find them, so they returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, after they were departed, that they came up out of the well, and went and told king David, and said unto David, Arise, and pass quickly over the water: for thus hath Ahithophel counselled against you.
verses.ct: After the searchers left, the two men climbed out of the well and went to tell King David. They said to David, "Get up and cross the water quickly, because Ahithophel has advised an attack against you."

verses.kjv: Then David arose, and all the people that were with him, and they passed over Jordan: by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over Jordan.
verses.ct: So David and everyone with him got up and crossed the Jordan. By dawn, every single person had made it across.

verses.kjv: And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his ass, and arose, and gat him home to his house, to his city, and put his household in order, and hanged himself, and died, and was buried in the sepulchre of his father.
verses.ct: When Ahithophel realized that his advice had not been followed, he saddled his donkey, went home to his own city, put his affairs in order, and hanged himself. He died and was buried in his father's tomb.

verses.kjv: Then David came to Mahanaim. And Absalom passed over Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.
verses.ct: David arrived at Mahanaim. Meanwhile, Absalom crossed the Jordan with all the men of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Absalom made Amasa captain of the host instead of Joab: which Amasa was a man’s son, whose name was Ithra an Israelite, that went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah Joab’s mother.
verses.ct: Absalom had appointed Amasa as commander of the army in place of Joab. Amasa was the son of a man named Ithra, an Israelite who had relations with Abigail, the daughter of Nahash and sister of Zeruiah, Joab's mother.

verses.kjv: So Israel and Absalom pitched in the land of Gilead.
verses.ct: Israel and Absalom set up camp in the land of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when David was come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lodebar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,
verses.ct: When David arrived at Mahanaim, Shobi son of Nahash from Rabbah of the Ammonites, Machir son of Ammiel from Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite from Rogelim

verses.kjv: Brought beds, and basons, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and flour, and parched corn, and beans, and lentiles, and parched pulse,
verses.ct: brought beds, basins, pottery, wheat, barley, flour, roasted grain, beans, lentils, roasted seeds,

verses.kjv: And honey, and butter, and sheep, and cheese of kine, for David, and for the people that were with him, to eat: for they said, The people is hungry, and weary, and thirsty, in the wilderness.
verses.ct: honey, butter, sheep, and cheese for David and the people with him to eat. They said, "These people must be hungry, exhausted, and thirsty from the wilderness."
